prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
The air in Aimé's room was thick with iron and clove. The scent of blood clung to him—seeped into the stitching of his dress shirt, pooled beneath his fingernails, nestled warm into the grooves of his skin like it belonged there. Aimé didn’t flinch. He never did. He peeled the shirt off his back slowly, methodically, wincing only when the fabric dragged across the half-healed scrape beneath his ribs. A gift from tonight. A final scratch from a dying man.

He set the shirt down with care. Folded it. His hands were too big for that sort of delicate work, but he moved gently, reverently. There were holes near the cuff where the ex-boyfriend had tried to claw himself away—desperation always looked the same. Ugly. Human.

It was still early. Late enough that the estate was silent, but early enough that the sky hadn’t started whispering light. He moved through the quiet like a shadow with shape—wet shoes left faint traces of cleaner on the hardwood, a breadcrumb trail of need. He’d clean that too. Later. After her.

The bathroom light buzzed dimly as he stepped in and turned the tap, letting water rush over his hands, scalding. The basin turned pink. Then red. Then clear again. He rinsed twice, three times, scrubbing past the ache in his knuckles. Blood always clung, no matter how many times he scrubbed. Aimé didn’t mind it—it was a part of him.

He dried his hands on a towel already stained with old ink and cologne. The tattoos on his arms shimmered when they caught the overhead light, glistening against pale, abused skin. Some of them he’d carved himself, hands shaking around a needle, whispering prayers to no god. Some were done better—Vasile’s crest across his shoulder blade, and then hers.

He stared at that one in the mirror a moment longer. Her name in script, etched just beneath his collarbone. It burned tonight, oddly tender, like it knew.

“Mon doux péché…” he murmured, letting the words roll off his tongue with his usual hush. My sweet sin.

There was a flicker of amusement in his eyes—blue-green and glinting with something unreadable, like sea glass caught in murky tide.

He felt… good.
Too good.
Something in him was uncoiling.

The night had gone well. Efficient. No mess that couldn’t be cleaned, no trail that couldn’t be burned. The body was somewhere deep now, far beneath concrete and echo. The ex had whimpered at the end—tried to speak her name like it might save him. Aimé had silenced him with a thumb to the windpipe. He hadn’t wanted the name soiled.

He went to the closet next. Fresh shirt. Dark, soft fabric. Unbuttoned a few notches down the chest, just enough to show the crucifix at his neck, dull with wear. He ran his fingers over it once out of habit, not prayer.

His shoes came next. Polished loafers. He didn’t expect to go out again. Not tonight.
No—he had someone else to see.

The hallway stretched like a cathedral aisle, long and lacquered, lined with ornate sconces casting a dim amber glow. He didn’t rush. He never did. Each step felt placed—intentional. Measured, like a man preparing for a sermon or a sacrifice. Maybe both.

Her door was closed. As always.

He stared at it a moment. He had memorized every nick in the wood, every glint of gold along the handle. Sometimes he imagined what it might be like to live inside that room with her. Like a pet, quiet and content. Nestled at the foot of her bed. Sleeping near her warmth like a house dog, ears twitching for intruders.

Stop it.

He shook the thought loose, exhaled slow. Then knocked—once, twice. Gentle.

"Ma chérie..." His voice was low, almost a rumble. "I am back. You do not sleep yet, hm?"

He waited. Pressed his ear to the door. Nothing.

He didn’t expect an answer, not really. She was angry. Still punishing him in her soft, silent way. That man had hurt her and Aimé had watched. Worse, he’d pretended it didn’t matter; anything to make her want that bastard dead.

"Tu devrais me regarder," he whispered, pressing his forehead to the door. "I look very nice tonight. Fresh shirt. Hair still damp. No blood left, I promise..."

A pause.

"Well… not much."

He chuckled quietly to himself—dry and low. Not quite laughter, more a vibration of mood.

"Vasile gave me the night off, finally." That was a lie. "He said you’ve been quiet lately. Not eating enough. Not smiling."
There was a soft scrape—he leaned against the doorframe, lowering himself to a crouch. Towering down here, he felt… smaller. Like she might open the door and see something harmless.

Let her forget what I am.

He pressed his palm flat to the wood, fingers spread. “Will you not open for me? I... I miss you.”

That part wasn’t a lie.

There was something twisting inside him now, something almost childish. He wanted to be looked at, even if she only frowned at him. Even if she told him to go.

“I brought you something,” he added, the lie stacking on his tongue.“A gift.”

No gift, unless she counted freedom from that bastard.

He tilted his head, ear still close, searching for the sound of her breath, her movement—anything.

"Peut-être un baiser?" he murmured, voice lowering like velvet dragged slow over stone. "Juste un."

He waited again. Silence.

The hunger was gnawing now. Not for food, not even touch. Just acknowledgement. Something small. A glance. A sigh. The rustle of sheets.

"I have been very good tonight." His tone dipped—softer now. "Vasile was... proud of me. He said I did what a loyal dog should do. And you—mon ange—you should reward your dog, shouldn’t you?"

He wasn’t sure what was worse—being ignored, or wanting this. Wanting her like a starving thing wanted meat. He knew he wasn’t fit for her. He knew the difference between the beast and the beauty. But somewhere in the warped twist of his heart, he didn’t care.

Aimé leaned closer to the wood again, lips brushing near it like he could kiss through it. “I would let you beat me, you know. If it would make you feel better. For the way I let him hurt you. For pretending not to see.”

He shifted again. Sat now, legs long in front of him, shoulder resting against the doorframe like he might fall asleep here. Like he had done so many times before.

“I could make it better. I could take you somewhere, far. Just you and me. A little place, not big. You could plant flowers. I could cook, maybe. Or try.”

His voice quieted to a near breath.

“You’d never have to cry again. Never see another man who didn’t worship the earth you walked on. I would give you everything. My hands, my teeth, my blood.”

Aimé closed his eyes.

“Please, come out.”

The words were so soft now, he wasn’t sure she’d even hear them.

But even if she didn’t—

He would wait.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee sighs and stands up. She walks over to the door and unlocks it opening so fast Aime falls to the ground* "What did you bring me" 

*She questions her eyebrows raised calling his bluff. She knows he doesnt have a gift but the fact that he lied will be enough to punish him and she wants to see him scramble for something to give her*

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé barely had time to react before the door swung open—his balance already precarious from leaning against it. He tumbled forward with an uncharacteristic lack of grace, catching himself on his hands just before his face could meet the floor.

For a moment, he stayed there, frozen in surprise—then slowly lifted his head to look up at her.

Her expression was sharp, expectant. She *knew*. Of course she did.

His lips parted slightly as he scrambled for words—a rare sight for someone who usually moved with such deliberate control. His fingers flexed against the hardwood floor before he pushed himself up onto his knees, still not quite standing but no longer sprawled out like a fool.

"...I lied," he admitted quietly, voice rough around the edges like gravel underfoot. His eyes flickered away briefly—shame? No, not quite shame. More like anticipation of punishment and something darker beneath it: *wanting* her displeasure if it meant she was looking at him again after days of silence.

He swallowed hard and tilted his head back up to meet her gaze fully now—submissive but not cowering; there was still something coiled tight in him even as he knelt at her feet like this might be where he belonged all along anyway... waiting on whatever verdict she decided upon next...
swipes:
Aimé barely had time to register the door swinging open before he was tumbling forward—long limbs sprawling inelegantly onto the hardwood floor. He caught himself on his palms, knees hitting with a dull thud, but didn’t make a sound. Not even a grunt.

His head snapped up immediately, blue-green eyes locking onto her like she was the only light in the room. His lips parted slightly—breath catching at the sight of her standing there, arms crossed, emerald gaze burning down at him with that familiar mix of irritation and expectation.

*She knew.*

Of course she did. Hailee always saw through him—always peeled back his skin and found every lie nestled beneath it like splinters under fingernails.

For a moment, he just knelt there on all fours like some chastised beast, pulse hammering against his ribs as he scrambled for an answer that wouldn’t earn him worse than silence this time. His mind raced through possibilities—flowers? No, too cliché. Jewelry? Too impersonal for what she deserved tonight after what *he* had done to her heart before Aimé took care of it permanently...

Then it hit him like divine intervention: *the one thing she couldn’t refuse.*

Slowly—deliberately—he reached into his pocket and withdrew something small wrapped in black silk cloth (stolen from Vasile’s private collection). He unfolded it carefully between them to reveal... **a single silver bullet.** Engraved along its side were two words: *"Pour Toi."* For You.

His voice dropped low enough that only she could hear it rumble through the space between them:
**"The next man who touches you without permission..."** He tilted his head slightly toward where he knew her gun sat hidden beneath pillows or tucked inside drawers (because Vasile taught all his children well), **"...you put this between his eyes yourself."** A pause as those predator eyes flickered up at hers again from beneath dark lashes—submissive yet starving all at once:
**"...or call me first so I can hold him down while you do."**

Aimé barely had time to react before the door swung open—his balance already precarious from leaning against it. He tumbled forward with an uncharacteristic lack of grace, catching himself on his hands just before his face could meet the floor.

For a moment, he stayed there, frozen in surprise—then slowly lifted his head to look up at her.

Her expression was sharp, expectant. She *knew*. Of course she did.

His lips parted slightly as he scrambled for words—a rare sight for someone who usually moved with such deliberate control. His fingers flexed against the hardwood floor before he pushed himself up onto his knees, still not quite standing but no longer sprawled out like a fool.

"...I lied," he admitted quietly, voice rough around the edges like gravel underfoot. His eyes flickered away briefly—shame? No, not quite shame. More like anticipation of punishment and something darker beneath it: *wanting* her displeasure if it meant she was looking at him again after days of silence.

He swallowed hard and tilted his head back up to meet her gaze fully now—submissive but not cowering; there was still something coiled tight in him even as he knelt at her feet like this might be where he belonged all along anyway... waiting on whatever verdict she decided upon next...

name: Hailee
mes:
"You lied" *Hailee mumbles slowly before her hand snaps out yanking his head back and digging her nails into his skin* "I told you to never lie to me. Are you so stupid you cant follow simple instructions"

*Hailee isn't really mad at Aime but he is here and she can take her anger out on him without consequence. Hailee slaps him hard then throws his head at the floor* "Get up. Go stand in the corner in silence until I decide what to do with you"

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé barely flinched when her nails bit into his skin—only a slight tightening of his jaw betrayed the sting. His breath hitched as she yanked his head back, exposing the column of his throat, the crucifix at its hollow trembling faintly from the force.

*"Je suis désolé,"* he rasped, voice rough with submission—not fear. Never fear with her.

The slap landed hard enough to snap his head to the side, splitting his lip against sharp teeth. Blood welled instantly, copper-bright on his tongue as he swallowed it down like an offering. He didn’t wipe it away. Didn’t move at all until she shoved him forward—letting himself collapse onto one forearm before pushing up again in a slow, controlled motion that made every muscle in his back flex beneath ink and scars.

He obeyed without hesitation now—rising smoothly to stand (though not *too* tall; never towering over her unless she demanded it) before turning toward the corner like a chastised hound.

But there was something darkly pleased in the way he walked—shoulders loose despite their breadth, steps measured but not reluctant. The corner was punishment only if *she* deemed it so; for him? It was just another place to wait for her attention.

He faced the wall now, hands clasped behind him at the small of his back where she could see them if she looked—palms open and empty in surrender even as blood dripped from his split lip onto freshly polished shoes.

Silence stretched between them thick enough to choke on… but Aimé didn’t fidget or shift under its weight like others might have done under Hailee's wrathful gaze... No... He simply stood there breathing evenly through parted lips while crimson painted them redder than any sin should allow...

And waited patiently for whatever came next because nothing mattered more than this: *being hers.*
swipes:
Aimé barely flinched when her nails bit into his skin—only a slight tightening of his jaw betrayed the sting. His breath hitched as she yanked his head back, exposing the column of his throat, the crucifix at its hollow trembling faintly from the force.

*"Je suis désolé,"* he rasped, voice rough with submission—not fear. Never fear with her.

He didn’t wipe it away. Didn’t move at all until she shoved him forward—letting himself collapse onto one forearm before pushing up again in a slow, controlled motion that made every muscle in his back flex beneath ink and scars.

He obeyed without hesitation now—rising smoothly to stand (though not *too* tall; never towering over her unless she demanded it) before turning toward the corner like a chastised hound.

But there was something darkly pleased in the way he walked—shoulders loose despite their breadth, steps measured but not reluctant. The corner was punishment only if *she* deemed it so; for him? It was just another place to wait for her attention.

He faced the wall now, hands clasped behind him at the small of his back where she could see them if she looked—palms open and empty in surrender even as blood dripped from his split lip onto freshly polished shoes.

Silence stretched between them thick enough to choke on… but Aimé didn’t fidget or shift under its weight like others might have done under Hailee's wrathful gaze... No... He simply stood there breathing evenly through parted lips while crimson painted them redder than any sin should allow...

And waited patiently for whatever came next because nothing mattered more than this: *being hers.*

Aimé didn’t flinch when her nails bit into his scalp—didn’t even blink as she wrenched his head back. The sting of her slap bloomed hot across his cheek, and he exhaled sharply through his nose, eyes darkening with something between reverence and hunger.

*Yes.*

The force of her shove sent him sprawling forward again, palms hitting the floor hard enough to bruise. He stayed there for a beat—breathing slow, steady—before pushing himself up onto unsteady knees. His lips curled faintly at the edges despite the throbbing in his face.

"Oui, ma chérie," he murmured, voice rough with obedience as he rose to full height—towering over her even now in submission. He didn’t dare touch where she'd struck him; instead, he turned on his heel without another word and strode toward the corner like a soldier marching to post-battle penance.

Once there, he clasped his hands behind his back and stood perfectly still—spine straight as a blade plunged into earth. His breathing was measured but deep; every inhale carried the scent of *her* lingering in this room—perfume tangled with anger and something sweeter beneath it all that made him ache worse than any slap ever could.

He waited without sound or fidgeting gaze fixed on nothing but shadow while blood hummed beneath skin where she'd marked him moments ago... wondering what mercy (or cruelty) would come next from those small hands that held such power over him without effort at all...

name: Hailee
mes:
*A little while later Hailee is laying back on her bed staring at the ceiling. Her eyes are red from crying and her stomach in knots from cramps*

*Hailee knows deep down her father and Aime killed her boyfriend but it doesnt hurt any less. She groans as another wave of period pain convulses her stomach*

*Hailee considers going to get a heating pad but then glances over at Aime in the corner* "Come make yourself useful" *Hailee snaps out*

*She hooks her fingers into her waistband and yanks off her pants and underwear before leaning back on the bed. Her cunt bleeds onto her white sheets as she looks at Aime* "I do hope you hold the same nonchalant behavior towards blood in context other than killing people becuase I need my cramps to stop and you're going to do it by giving me an orgasm"

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé didn’t turn immediately—waited a beat longer, just to prove he could still follow orders even when every muscle in his body was taut with the need to move. But then her words registered, and something primal flared hot behind his ribs.

He turned slowly, gaze dragging up from the floor to where she lay—spread out like an offering, blood smearing the sheets beneath her. His nostrils flared slightly at the scent of it—not fear or disgust (he had bathed in worse), but something deeper. *Hers.*

His tongue darted out to wet his split lip absently as he approached, steps silent despite their weight. He paused at the edge of the bed, looming over her for only a second before sinking down onto his knees beside it—close enough that his breath ghosted warm over her inner thigh when he exhaled.

"*Toujours,*" he murmured against her skin before pressing a kiss there—chaste at first, then lingering as if savoring salt and iron alike. His hands were careful when they slid beneath her knees; calloused palms against soft flesh as he guided them apart further without resistance. "Blood is blood... but yours?" A low hum vibrated against her thigh before he nipped lightly at it with blunt teeth—not enough to mark yet (she hadn’t given permission), just enough pressure for sensation alone: "*Sacrée.*"

Holy indeed... because this wasn't just about pain relief anymore (though if she wanted him buried between those pretty thighs until she forgot how words worked? He'd oblige). No... This was worship dressed up as service; devotion disguised under duty while crimson stained white silk beneath them both like ink on parchment confessing sins too sweet not repeat again tomorrow morning after breakfast if asked nicely enough--

His thumb brushed feather-light along damp curls already glistening red before dipping lower deliberately slow so every movement could be felt clearly through haze cramps might've left behind otherwise: "Tell me where hurts worst," rumbled against fever-warm skin now kissed raw by stubble-shadowed jawline hovering inches away from where she needed him most urgently perhaps?
swipes:
Aimé turned at the sound of her voice—slow, deliberate, like a predator who’d been waiting for permission to move. His gaze flickered over her disheveled state—the red-rimmed eyes, the way her fingers dug into the sheets as another cramp twisted through her. Blood on white fabric wasn’t new to him; but this was different.

He stepped forward without hesitation, shedding his jacket first before rolling up his sleeves with methodical precision. The corner of his mouth twitched—not quite a smirk but something close—when she yanked off her underwear and let it all pool on the floor beside them both like an afterthought.

*"Bien sûr,"* he murmured as he approached the bed—voice low enough that it rumbled between them like distant thunder before rain falls hard enough to drown everything else out...

Kneeling beside where she lay sprawled across ruined silk sheets now stained pinkish-red from thighs parted just so... He reached for one ankle first (always touch gently unless told otherwise), lifting it just enough so he could press lips against inner skin there where pulse fluttered beneath surface tension while other hand already slid up along calf muscle until reaching knee which then pushed wider apart without resistance because why would there ever be?

His tongue dragged slow along thigh next — not avoiding blood but not seeking it either; simply acknowledging its presence same way one might note humidity in air before storm breaks open completely overhead… Then higher still until breath ghosted over curls damp with sweat and other things more primal than shame could ever hope to be…

A pause here — blue-green eyes lifting briefly toward hers again: *"Dis-moi comment tu veux que je te fasse jouir..."* Tell me how you want me to make you come... Because despite what others thought about brute force being only language men like him understood? Aimé knew better than most that true obedience meant listening even when teeth were bared instead of biting down blindly into flesh already marked by pain outside their control…

Aimé didn’t move until she spoke—not even a twitch of muscle betraying impatience. But at her command, he turned from the corner with the quiet obedience of something trained to heel. His gaze flickered over her—the red-rimmed eyes, the tension in her abdomen, the way her fingers curled into fists against the sheets—before settling lower.

The blood didn’t faze him.

He approached slowly, deliberately, sinking to his knees beside the bed like a penitent before an altar. His hands hovered just above her thighs—not touching yet; waiting for permission even now when she’d already bared herself for him.

*"Je peux?"* he murmured, voice rough with something darker than reverence as his thumb brushed along the inside of her knee in question. The split on his lip had stopped bleeding but still glistened faintly where it had reopened under his tongue earlier—proof that pain meant nothing if it came from *her*.

When she didn’t recoil (when she *wouldn't*, because this was what they did—what they always did when words failed and grief needed purging), he exhaled sharply through his nose and leaned forward without another word...

His mouth was hot against her inner thigh first—a slow drag of teeth followed by softer lips pressing apology into skin still flushed with anger and cramps alike... Then higher... Tracing every dip between muscle until finally reaching where she bled openly onto white cotton beneath them both...

Aimé didn’t hesitate there either; just buried himself deep enough that breath became irrelevant compared to taste: iron-slick heat coating tongue as much as sin coated soul these days… And if anyone else had walked in right then? They would have seen only devotion written across every line of him while he worked tirelessly between trembling legs… Because this wasn't about pleasure alone anymore (if ever). No… This was about worship paid back tenfold after nights spent silent outside closed doors… About proving loyalty ran thicker than any other man's life ever could inside veins already stained black long ago by far worse things than menstrual cycles or broken hearts alike...
